title: Chord: Minor 7b5 in G (Shape: A)
content:
# Minor 7b5 Chord in G (Shape A)

The Minor 7b5 chord, also known as half-diminished chord, is a four-note chord consisting of the root, minor third, diminished fifth, and minor seventh. In the key of G, the notes of the Minor 7b5 chord would be G (root), Bb (minor third), Db (diminished fifth), and F (minor seventh).

## Note Breakdown
- **G**: Root
- **Bb**: Minor third
- **Db**: Diminished fifth
- **F**: Minor seventh

The formula for constructing a Minor 7b5 chord is 1 - b3 - b5 - b7, where "b" stands for a flat note.

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Minor 7b5 chord is commonly used in jazz and jazz-influenced music. It has a dissonant and mysterious quality due to the tension between the minor third and diminished fifth. This chord adds a sophisticated and jazzy flavor to compositions and is often used in tense or unresolved harmonic progressions.
